hours_text:
## Plan Your Visit

If you are coming with a group of fifteen or more or are a school group, please visit our [Group Tours](https://thebreman.org/Visit/Group-Tours) page to schedule your visit.

One of the leading destinations in Atlanta, GA, our Jewish culture, arts and history museum is home to the permanent exhibition [Absence of Humanity: The Holocaust Years, 1933-1945](https://thebreman.org/Exhibitions/Now-on-View/Absence-of-Humanity-The-Holocaust-Years-1933-1945); the Blonder Family Gallery hosts [History with Chutzpah: Remarkable Stories of the Southern Jewish Experience](https://thebreman.org/History-with-Chutzpah); and the Schwartz Gallery, which hosts a variety of traveling and rotating exhibitions. [The Norman L. Estroff Reference Library](https://thebreman.org/Research/The-Museum-Library), [The Ida Pearle and Joseph Cuba Archives for Southern Jewish History](https://thebreman.org/Research/Cuba-Family-Archives) and [The Weinberg Center for Holocaust Education](https://thebreman.org/Learn/Weinberg-Center-for-Holocaust-Education) provide a wonderful educational resource for students, teachers, and lifelong learners.

**Museum Visitation Hours**

Sunday – 11:00 AM – 4:00 PM

Monday – Closed

Tuesday – Closed

Wednesday – 11:00 AM – 4:00 PM

Thursday – 11:00 AM – 4:00 PM

Friday – 11:00 AM – 4:00 PM

Saturday – Closed

###### To learn more about our office hours click [here](https://thebreman.org/visit/contact-us/)

[ DIRECTIONS AND PARKING ](https://thebreman.org/visi...

# Spark Your Story Seeking

We are the cultural center where story keepers and story seekers come together to engage in dialogue, connect with history, and experience the arts.

[ PLAN YOUR VISIT ](https://thebreman.org/visit/)

What’s Happening at The Breman

## [Special Exhibition 18:18:18"Durational video can be watched during museum hours. Running now through January 31st."Read More](https://thebreman.org/181818-2/)

## [Fiddler on the Roof: Costumes & ContrastsNOW ON VIEW](https://thebreman.org/exhibitions/fiddler-on-the-roof-costumes-contrasts-an-exploration-of-tradition-identity/)

## [Group ToursWe offer in-person and virtual tours of our permanent exhibition, Absence of Humanity: The Holocaust Years, 1933-1945, and temporary exhibition, History with Chutzpah: Remarkable Stories of the Southern Jewish Experience. PLAN YOUR VISIT](https://thebreman.org/Visit/Group-Tours)

## [Exhibition On DisplayOur exhibition, Hidden History, is the story of a Jewish community in Shanghai and how it was one of the destinations for those fleeing the Nazis.LEARN MORE](https://thebreman.org/exhibitions/hidden-history/)

## [History With ChutzpahLittle Known Stories of Joy, Resiliency and Sweet Tea. The 250+ artifacts, documents, photographs and oral histories in the exhibition, reveal stories from the generations before us and offer you a journe...
